intro: Smyrnium dioscoridis, commonly known as the greater cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbrella-like inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers are small, greenish-white with prominent yellow stamens. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
